items.summary: Redesign the HomePage with a Tubi-inspired layout: replace the current hero/featured section with a prominent full-width hero banner showcasing featured content (with play and more-info CTAs), followed by horizontal scrollable genre/category content rows (Movies, TV Shows, Podcasts, Originals, etc.), and clean VideoCard/SeriesCard layouts with hover effects and smooth transitions. The Shorts/Clips vertical feed and existing functional sections must be preserved and integrated into the new layout.

Add Disney+-style brand/network rails to the HomePage and the NetworksPage: group content by brand/network with the brand logo as a section header, followed by a horizontal carousel of associated content (videos, series, clips). Each brand rail should link to the full BrandDetailPage.

Redesign the global navigation Header toward a Tubi-style top nav with a VOD-first focus: reorder navigation links to prioritize VOD categories (Movies, TV Shows, Podcasts, Originals) with Live TV as a secondary entry, make the search bar more prominent, ensure the Live Guide entry point remains accessible, and improve mobile responsiveness with a clean hamburger/drawer menu.

Redesign the VOD browsing and discovery pages — MoviesPage, TVShowsPage, and any PodcastsPage — with Tubi-style genre/category filtering and clean content grid layouts. Each page should include filter tabs or chips for genre/category at the top, followed by a responsive content grid. Apply the same treatment consistently across all three pages.

Update the visual theme across the entire app to be slightly more vibrant while remaining within the existing dark red/black style: use richer, more saturated reds (e.g., deeper crimson to vivid scarlet range), improve contrast for text and UI elements against dark backgrounds, apply more dynamic card treatments (subtle glow or saturated border on hover/focus), and ensure the updated palette is applied consistently via the existing Tailwind/OKLCH color configuration.
